description: The 521-bit ECDSA key type used in PuTTY may compromise the privacy and integrity of private keys due to weaknesses associated with this specific key size. System administrators utilizing this key type need to be aware of potential risks involved in using 521-bit ECDSA keys, as they are the only affected key type as highlighted in related discussions. This issue may affect systems relying on these keys, particularly in secure communications facilitated by PuTTY. While the statement indicates that this is the only affected key size, it underscores the importance of reviewing key management practices within secure environments. Recommendations may involve transitioning to more robust key sizes to mitigate any associated risks.
